title: Blue Origin to lay off 10% of its workforce
summary:
Blue Origin is laying off 10% of its workforce, or more than 1,000 employees, citing the need to restructure the company and reduce bureaucracy.
The post Blue Origin to lay off 10% of its workforce appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: NASA Readies Moon Rocket for the Future with Manufacturing Innovation
summary: NASA’s Artemis campaign will send astronauts, payloads, and science experiments into deep space on NASA’s SLS (Space Launch System) super heavy-lift Moon rocket. title: NASA’s SPHEREx Space Telescope Will Seek Life’s Ingredients
summary: Where is all the water that may form oceans on distant planets and moons? The SPHEREx astrophysics mission will search the galaxy and take stock. Every living organism on Earth needs water to survive, so scientists searching for life outside our solar system, are often guided by the phrase “follow the water.” Scheduled to launch […]

title: In the Starlight: Tristan McKnight Brings NASA’s Historic Moments to Life
summary: For more than a decade, Tristan McKnight has been a driving force behind some of NASA’s most iconic events, orchestrating the behind-the-scenes magic that brings each historic moment to life while sharing the agency’s advancements with the public.  As a multimedia producer on the audiovisual team at Johnson Space Center in Houston, McKnight produces and […]

title: Citing too much “bureaucracy,” Blue Origin to cut 10 percent of its workforce
summary: "We grew and hired incredibly fast in the last few years."

title: Webb Maps Full Picture of How Phoenix Galaxy Cluster Forms Stars
summary: Discovery proves decades-old theory of galaxy feeding cycle. Researchers using NASA’s James Webb Space Telescope have finally solved the mystery of how a massive galaxy cluster is forming stars at such a high rate. The confirmation from Webb builds on more than a decade of studies using NASA’s Chandra X-ray Observatory and Hubble Space Telescope, […]

title: China’s answer to SpaceX
summary:
In this week's episode of Space Minds meet Yao Song, a Chinese entrepreneur and CEO of Orienspace. Raised in a Communist revolution, Orienspace’s founder now aims to outpace Elon Musk and lead China’s private space race.
